headline: Oh Wait
description: A playful yet solemn poem-fragment meditating on letting go and the paradox of release—whether one has nothing, gold, or obligation. The phrase 'Oh wait!' punctuates each stanza with irony, hesitation, and humor, undercutting solemnity with lightness.
author: Aleksandr
whyItMatters: The poem captures Aleksandr’s ability to balance solemn reflection with irony. By placing 'Oh wait!' as both comic interruption and tragic refrain, the work embodies the Trickster Prophet phase—oscillating between wisdom and jest, grief and laughter.

motifMap.meaning: The difficulty of letting go regardless of wealth or poverty
Celestial witness to human struggle with release
Comic break that unsettles solemn reflection, emblem of Trickster wisdom

articleExcerpt: Letting go is harder / When you have little to hold. / Oh wait!

sourceFragments.description: First Substack post draft and screenshot of published form

associatedMedia.description: Symbolic illustration of hands releasing gold before a moon
